content.description: Start standing on the obvious rail, mantle, and then climb up the slab.
content.location: To the right of $600. Starts below the east arete and climbs up the east face.

content.description: Sit start way down low on the slopers below the obvious crimp. Climb to the rail used for the stand start and ascend the slab.
Climb the west face. Avoid using the aretes for full value (still a V0).
content.location: The west face of the New Year boulder.

content.description: Climb the north face. Beware the loose block at the top of the right arete.
content.protection: There's room for one crashpad at the base. Likelihood of falling is very low.
content.location: The south face of the New Year Boulder.

content.description: Start on the sloper to the right of the little cave and traverse left along the crimps and slopers forming the lip of the cave. Joins and finishes up Skeleton Hand. The lip above the start hold and the small boulder just below the starting sloper are both OFF.
content.location: Starts on the sloper on the lower right side of the east face and traverses from right to left, joining Skeleton Hand.

climbs.name: $600 for the Rest of Your Life

content.description: Climb the south face. Slightly more challenging but still V0 without the aretes.
content.location: The north face of the boulder. The left side if you're looking at it from the trail.

content.description:
We survived 2020! Here's a new boulder for a new year!

 A small limestone boulder located right off the popular Thousand Steps Trail in Franklin Mountains State Park. The rock quality is better than most of the stuff at Crazy Cat. There are a couple worthwhile problems and potential eliminates & variations for when you don't have a reservation or tour at Hueco and you've run out of stuff to do at Crazy Cat. The V0s would be very good for someone new to bouldering outside. We're guessing some or all of the lines had been climbed before. If anyone knows of older ascents or problem names, I'd be happy to fix it. We first climbed here on January 1, 2021.
